docs.title: datadog update-log-archive-azure
docs.text: Update an existing archive

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update an existing archive

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
datadog update-log-archive-azure
    [--site <site>]
[<archive>]
[--include_tags]
--name <name>
    --query <query>
    [--rehydration_size <rehydration_size>]
[--rehydration_tags <rehydration_tags>]
--container <container>
    [--path <path>]
[--region <region>]
[--client_id <client_id>]
[--tenant_id <tenant_id>]
[--storage_account <storage_account>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: archive - (string)
docs.text: Archive ID      Example: "archive-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: include_tags - (bool)
docs.text: set "true" to save tags. Else, the tags will be deleted when logs sent to archive      Example: --include_tags      Default: false      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The archive name      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: The archive query/filter. Logs matching this query are included in the archive      Example: --query "query-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: rehydration_size - (int)
docs.text: Maximum scan size for rehydration in gb from this archive      Example: --rehydration_size 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: rehydration_tags - (string)
docs.text: An array of tags to add to rehydrated logs from an archive      Example: --rehydration_tags "rehydration_tags-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: container - (string)
docs.text: The container/Bucket where the archive will be stored      Example: --container "container-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: path - (string)
docs.text: The archive path      Example: --path "path-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: The Azure region where the archive will be stored      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: client_id - (string)
docs.text: Required client ID      Example: --client_id "client_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: tenant_id - (string)
docs.text: Required tenant ID      Example: --tenant_id "tenant_id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: storage_account - (string)
docs.text: Required associated storage account      Example: --storage_account "storage_account-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!datadog update-log-archive-azure  "a2zcMylnM4OCHpYusxIi3g" --container "Container1" --query "*" --name "Nginx Archive"
Output: 
ID                      NAME          QUERY         STATE    DESTINATION-ACCOUNT DESTINATION-CONTAINER  DESTINATION-PATH                  CLIENT                TENANT
a2zcMylnM4OCHpYusxIi3g  Nginx Archive source:nginx  WORKING  testAcc             Container1             /container/a2zcMylnM4OCHpYusxIi3g aaaa-1a1a-1a1a-aaaa   aaaa-1a1a-1a1a-aaaa

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "datadog" Service Instance Namespace Object Type "archive" Object ID

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.text:
ec2 delete-volume
    [--site <site>]
[--region <region>]

docs.title: elasticsearch
docs.text:
ElasticSearch Commands

SubCommands:

• cancel-tasks: Cancel a long-running task

• clear-cache: Clear the caches of one or more indices

• close-index: Closes Index

• cluster-reroute: Change the allocation of shards in a cluster.

• create-index: Create a new elastic search index

• delete-by-query: Delete documents that match the specific query

• delete-document: delete document from index

• delete-index: Delete elastic search index

• get-cluster-allocation: Get an explanation for shards current allocation

• get-cluster-health: Get elastic search cluster health

• get-cluster-settings: Get elastic search cluster wide settings

• get-cluster-state: Get elastic search cluster state

• get-cluster-statistics: Get elastic search cluster statistics

• get-document: get document from index

• get-ilm-status: Get current index lifecycle management status

• get-index: Get elastic search index

• get-index-segments: Get elastic search index segments

• get-index-settings: Get elastic search index settings

• get-index-stats: get stats of indices

• get-node-stats: Get elastic search node statistics

• get-shards: Get detailed view of what nodes contain which shards

• get-tasks: Get tasks currently executing in the cluster.

• ilm-explain: Explain index lifecycle management

• ilm-retry: Retry executing the policy for an index in ERROR step

• list-cluster-allocation: Get compact and aligned text explanation for shards

• nodes-info: Get cluster nodes information

• open-index: Open closed index

• pending-tasks: Get cluster-level pending tasks

• raw: Run an elasticsearch raw command based REST API

• recoveries: Get shard recoveries

• rollover: Rollover an index alias or data stream

• search: Search with a given query

• shrink-index: Shrink an existing index

• split-index: Split an existing index

• start-ilm: Start the index lifecycle management (ILM) plugin

• stop-ilm: Stop the index lifecycle management (ILM) plugin

• update-by-query: Update documents that match the specified query

• update-cluster-settings: update elastic search cluster settings

• update-document: update elastic search document

• update-index-settings: update elastic search index settings

docs.title: elasticsearch cancel-tasks
docs.text: Cancel a long-running task

docs.title: Description
docs.text: If a long-running task supports cancellation, it can be cancelled with the cancel-tasks

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch cancel-tasks
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--task_id <task_id>]
[--actions <actions>]
[--node_id <node_id>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: task_id - (string)
docs.text: Task Id to cancel      Example: --task_id "oTUltX4IQMOUUVeiohTt8A:124"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: actions - (string)
docs.text: Used to cancel multiple tasks of same action at a time      Example: --actions "cluster:*, *search"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: node_id - (string)
docs.text: Node IDs or names used to limit tasks to cancel      Example: --node_id "node-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: elasticsearch cancel-tasks --task_id "oTUltX4IQMOUUVeiohTt8A:124" --actions "cluster:, search" --node_id "node-1"

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "task" Object ID

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: elasticsearch clear-cache
docs.text: Clear the caches of one or more indices

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Clear the caches of one or more indices

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch clear-cache
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--target <target>]
[--fielddata]
[--fields <fields>]
[--query]
[--request]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: target - (string)
docs.text: List of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request      Example: --target "students or _all"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: fielddata - (bool)
docs.text: If set, clears the cache. If fields argument is specified, cache is cleared for specified fields only      Example: --fielddata      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: fields - (string)
docs.text: List of field names used to limit the fielddata parameter. Defaults to all fields.      Example: --fields "foo"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: query - (bool)
docs.text: If set, clears the query cache      Example: --query      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: request - (bool)
docs.text: If set, clears the request cache      Example: --request      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch clear-cache --cluster "elastic-1" --fielddata --target "class"
Output: 
{
"_shards": {
"total": 4,
"successful": 2,
"failed": 0
}
}

docs.title: elasticsearch cluster-reroute
docs.text: Change the allocation of shards in a cluster.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Change the allocation of shards in a cluster.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch cluster-reroute
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--dry_run]
[--explain]
[--retry_failed]
--command <command>
    --index <index>
    --shard <shard>
    [--node <node>]
[--to_node <to_node>]
[--allow_primary]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: dry_run - (bool)
docs.text: If set, then the request simulates the operation and returns the resulting state, but will not actually perform the requested changes.      Example: --dry_run      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: explain - (bool)
docs.text: If set, then the response contains an explanation of why the commands can or cannot be executed.      Example: --explain      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: retry_failed - (bool)
docs.text: If set, then retries allocation of shards that are blocked due to too many subsequent allocation failures      Example: --retry_failed      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: command - (string)
docs.text: Command to perform. Can be either move/ cancel/ allocate_replica      Example: --command "move"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Index on which command is performed      Example: --index "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: shard - (int)
docs.text: Shard on which command is performed      Example: --shard 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: node - (string)
docs.text: Node from which shard should move or node from which shared allocation should be cancelled or node to which unassigned replica should be allocated      Example: --node "node2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: to_node - (string)
docs.text: In case of move command, node to which shard is moved      Example: --to_node "node2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: allow_primary - (bool)
docs.text: By default only replica shard allocations can be cancelled. If it is necessary to cancel the allocation of a primary shard then the allow_primary flag must be set      Example: --allow_primary      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples

! elasticsearch cluster-reroute --cluster "elastic-1" --shard 1 --index "test1" --command "cancel" --node "beehyv-H81M-S"

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "index" Object ID index

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: elasticsearch create-index
docs.text: Create a new elastic search index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create a new elastic search index

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch create-index
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<index>
    [--shards <shards>]
[--replicas <replicas>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)

}

docs.title: query - (string)

docs.title: async - (bool)

docs.title: elasticsearch get-cluster-allocation
docs.text: Get an explanation for shards current allocation

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get an explanation for shards current allocation.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch get-cluster-allocation
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
--index <index>
    <shard>
    [--primary]
--current_node <current_node>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of the index that you would like an explanation for.      Example: --index "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: shard - (int)
docs.text: ID of the shard that you would like an explanation for.      Example: 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: primary - (bool)
docs.text: If set, returns explanation for the primary shard for the given shard ID.      Example: --primary      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: current_node - (string)
docs.text: Specifies the node ID or the name of the node to only explain a shard that is currently located on the specified node.      Example: --current_node "node-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: elasticsearch get-cluster-health
docs.text: Get elastic search cluster health

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get the health status of a cluster

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch get-cluster-health
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
[--raw]
[--target <target>]
[--level <level>]
[--local]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: raw - (bool)
docs.text: If false, returns compact and aligned text output      Example: --raw      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: target - (string)
docs.text: List of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request      Example: --target "students or _all"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: level - (string)
docs.text: Can be either cluster/indices/shards. Controls the details level of the health information returned      Example: --level "cluster"      Default: cluster      Attributes: optional

docs.title: local - (bool)
docs.text: If set, the request retrieves information from the local node only. By default information is retrieved from the master node.      Example: --local      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch get-cluster-health --cluster "elastic-1" --target "class" --target "test" --level "cluster" --local --raw

docs.title: elasticsearch get-document
docs.text: get document from index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieves the specified JSON document from an index

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch get-document
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
--index <index>
    <id>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of the index that contains the document.      Example: --index "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: id - (int)
docs.text: Unique identifier of the document.      Example: 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch get-document --cluster "elastic-1" --index "my-index-000001" 1
Output: 
{
"_index": "my-index-000001",
"_type": "_doc",
"_id": "1",
"_version": 1,
"_seq_no": 0,
"_primary_term": 1,
"found": true,
"_source": {
"@timestamp": "2099-11-15T13:12:00",
"message": "GET /search HTTP/1.1 200 1070000",
"user": {
"id": "kimchy"
}
}
}

docs.title: elasticsearch get-index-settings
docs.text: Get elastic search index settings

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get settings info for one or more indices

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch get-index-settings
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
<index>
    [--settings <settings>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of indices (also supports wild card expression)      Example: "students,class / _all / log_2099_*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: settings - (string)
docs.text: List or wildcard expression of setting names to filter the request      Example: --settings "index.number_*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

! elasticsearch get-index-settings --cluster "elastic-1" "my_source_index" "test"

}

"blocks": {
"write": "true"
},

"creation_date": "1632834248780",
"number_of_replicas": "0",
"uuid": "tkkO4G2UQ_KDXfOUgZVuGQ",
"version": {
"created": "7140299"
}
}

docs.title: elasticsearch get-index-stats
docs.text: get stats of indices

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns statistics for one or more indices. For data streams, the API retrieves statistics for the stream’s backing indices.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch get-index-stats
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
<index>
    [--metrics <metrics>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of indices (supports wild card expression)      Example: "students" , "class" , "_all" , "log_2099_*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: metrics - (string)
docs.text: List of metrics used to limit the request. Possible values are completion, docs, field data, flush, get, indexing, merge, query_cache, refresh, request_cache, search, segments, store, suggest, translog, warmer      Example: --metrics "fielddata,flush,refresh"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "read" Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "index" Object ID index

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: elasticsearch get-node-stats
docs.text: Get elastic search node statistics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns node statistics.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch get-node-stats
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
[--nodes <nodes>]
[--metrics <metrics>]
[--index_metric <index_metric>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: nodes - (string)
docs.text: List of node IDs or names used to limit returned information.      Example: --nodes "node-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: metrics - (string)
docs.text: Limits the information returned to the specific metrics      Example: --metrics "breaker, discovery, http, indices, ingest"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: index_metric - (string)
docs.text: Limit the information returned for indices metric to the specific index metrics. It can be used only if indices (or all) metric is specified      Example: --index_metric "completion, docs, fielddata, flush, indexing, merge, query_cache"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

docs.title: elasticsearch get-shards
docs.text: Get detailed view of what nodes contain which shards

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get detailed view of what nodes contain which shards along with info whether it’s a primary or replica, the number of docs, the bytes it takes on disk, and the node where it’s located.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch get-shards
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--target <target>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
[--sort <sort>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: target - (string)
docs.text: List of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request      Example: --target "students or _all"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: sort - (string)
docs.text: Column names or column aliases used to sort the response.      Example: --sort "index,health"      Default: index      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x = ! elasticsearch get-shards --cluster "elastic-1" --target "test" --target "class"
Output: 
[
{
"index": "class",
"shard": "1",
"prirep": "p",
"state": "STARTED",
"docs": "0",
"store": "208b",
"ip": "127.0.0.1",
"node": "beehyv-H81M-S"
},
{
"index": "class",
"shard": "1",
"prirep": "r",
"state": "UNASSIGNED",
"docs": null,
"store": null,
"ip": null,
"node": null
},
{
"index": "class",
"shard": "0",
"prirep": "p",
"state": "STARTED",
"docs": "0",
"store": "208b",
"ip": "127.0.0.1",
"node": "beehyv-H81M-S"
},
{
"index": "class",
"shard": "0",
"prirep": "r",
"state": "UNASSIGNED",
"docs": null,
"store": null,
"ip": null,
"node": null
},
{
"index": "test",
"shard": "0",
"prirep": "p",
"state": "STARTED",
"docs": "0",
"store": "230b",
"ip": "127.0.0.1",
"node": "beehyv-H81M-S"
},

docs.title: elasticsearch get-tasks
docs.text: Get tasks currently executing in the cluster.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns information about the tasks currently executing on one or more nodes in the cluster.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch get-tasks
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
[--raw]
[--task <task>]
[--actions <actions>]
[--detailed]
[--node <node>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: raw - (bool)
docs.text: If false, returns compact and aligned text output      Example: --raw      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: task - (string)
docs.text: Task Id      Example: --task "oTUltX4IQMOUUVeiohTt8A:124"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: actions - (string)
docs.text: Used to limit the list of actions returned      Example: --actions "cluster:*, *search"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: detailed - (bool)
docs.text: If set, response returns detailed information of the task      Example: --detailed      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: node - (string)
docs.text: Node IDs or names used to limit returned information.      Example: --node "node-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: elasticsearch get-tasks --filter_path "index.mappings.properties." --raw --task "oTUltX4IQMOUUVeiohTt8A:124" --actions "cluster:, *search" --detailed --node "node-1"

docs.title: elasticsearch ilm-explain
docs.text: Explain index lifecycle management

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieve the current lifecycle status for one or more indices

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch ilm-explain
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--target <target>]
[--only_errors]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: target - (string)
docs.text: List of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request      Example: --target "students or _all"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: only_errors - (bool)
docs.text: If set, Filters the returned indices to only indices that are managed by ILM and are in an error state      Example: --only_errors      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch ilm-explain --cluster "elastic-1"
Output:

docs.title: elasticsearch ilm-retry
docs.text: Retry executing the policy for an index in ERROR step

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Set the policy back to the step where the error occurred and execute the step. Use ilm-explain to determine if an index is in the ERROR step.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch ilm-retry
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--index <index>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of the index      Example: --index "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch ilm-retry --cluster "elastic-1" --index "class"
Output: 
{
"error": {
"root_cause": [
{
"type": "illegal_argument_exception",
"reason": "cannot retry an action for an index [class] that has not encountered an error when running a Lifecycle Policy"
}
],
"type": "illegal_argument_exception",
"reason": "cannot retry an action for an index [class] that has not encountered an error when running a Lifecycle Policy"
},
"status": 400
}
Input: 
! elasticsearch ilm-retry --cluster "elastic-1" --index "test"
Output: 
{
"acknowledged": true
}

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Retrieves one or more (or all) of the cluster nodes information.

elasticsearch nodes-info
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
[--raw]
[<nodes>]
[--metric <metric>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: raw - (bool)
docs.text: If false, returns compact and aligned text output      Example: --raw      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: nodes - (string)
docs.text: Nodes      Example: "node1"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: metric - (string)
docs.text: Limits the information returned to the specific metrics      Example: --metric "http, ingest, jvm"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

"max": 2,
"keep_alive": "5m",
"queue_size": -1
},
"system_write": {
"type": "fixed",
"size": 2,
"queue_size": 1000
},
"generic": {
"type": "scaling",
"core": 4,
"max": 128,
"keep_alive": "30s",
"queue_size": -1
},
"warmer": {
"type": "scaling",
"core": 1,
"max": 2,
"keep_alive": "5m",
"queue_size": -1
},
"auto_complete": {
"type": "fixed",
"size": 1,
"queue_size": 100
},
"management": {
"type": "scaling",
"core": 1,
"max": 4,
"keep_alive": "5m",
"queue_size": -1
},
"analyze": {
"type": "fixed",
"size": 1,
"queue_size": 16
},
"searchable_snapshots_cache_prewarming": {
"type": "scaling",
"core": 0,
"max": 16,
"keep_alive": "30s",
"queue_size": -1
},
"ml_job_comms": {
"type": "scaling",
"core": 4,
"max": 2048,
"keep_alive": "1m",
"queue_size": -1
},
"snapshot": {
"type": "scaling",
"core": 1,
"max": 2,
"keep_alive": "5m",
"queue_size": -1
},
"search_throttled": {
"type": "fixed_auto_queue_size",
"size": 1,
"queue_size": 100
}
},
"transport": {
"bound_address": ["127.0.0.1:9300"],
"publish_address": "127.0.0.1:9300",
"profiles": {}
},
"http": {
"bound_address": ["127.0.0.1:9200"],

docs.title: elasticsearch open-index
docs.text: Open closed index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Opens a closed index. For data streams, this opens any closed backing indices.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch open-index
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<index>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Indices to open      Example: "students,books"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch open-index --cluster "elastic-1" "test" "test1"
Output: 
{
"acknowledged": true,
"shards_acknowledged": true
}

docs.title: elasticsearch pending-tasks
docs.text: Get cluster-level pending tasks

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get elastic search cluster-level changes that have not yet been executed

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch pending-tasks
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch pending-tasks --cluster "elastic-1"
Output: 
{
"tasks": []
}

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:

Field Value Action "read" Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "task" Object ID

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: elasticsearch raw
docs.text: Run an elasticsearch raw command based REST API

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Run an elasticsearch raw command based REST API, providing path, body and http method

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch raw
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--path <path>
    [--method <method>]
[--body <body>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: path - (string)
docs.text: REST API URL path      Example: --path "/my-index-01/_rollover"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: method - (string)
docs.text: HTTP method - GET/POST/PUT/DELETE      Example: --method "method-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: body - (string)
docs.text: Body for REST API, JSON formatted      Example: --body "{"field1": "value1"}"      Default: {}      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: elasticsearch raw --path "/my-index-01/_rollover" --method "method-1"

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action x = "read" if method == "PUT": x = "update" if method == "POST" x = "create" if method == "DELETE": x = "delete" x Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "raw_resource" Object ID index

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: elasticsearch recoveries
docs.text: Get shard recoveries

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get information about ongoing and completed shard recoveries

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch recoveries
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--target <target>]
[--filter_path <filter_path>]
[--sort <sort>]
[--active_only]
[--detailed]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: target - (string)
docs.text: List of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request      Example: --target "students or _all"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: filter_path - (string)
docs.text: Path in the response. Filters and returns only parts of response matching this path      Example: --filter_path "index.mappings.properties.*"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: sort - (string)
docs.text: List of column names or column aliases used to sort the response.      Example: --sort "index,health"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: active_only - (bool)
docs.text: If set, response only includes ongoing shard recoveries.      Example: --active_only      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: detailed - (bool)
docs.text: If set, response only includes detailed info of shard recoveries.      Example: --detailed      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples

! elasticsearch recoveries --cluster "elastic-1" --target "my-index-000001" --target "class" --detailed --sort "index" --sort "files"

docs.title: elasticsearch rollover
docs.text: Rollover an index alias or data stream

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Rollover an index alias or data stream to create a new index

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch rollover
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<target>
    [--target_index <target_index>]
[--max_age <max_age>]
[--max_docs <max_docs>]
[--max_size <max_size>]
[--max_primary_shard_size <max_primary_shard_size>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: target - (string)
docs.text: Name of the rollover target index alias or data stream      Example: "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: target_index - (string)
docs.text: Name for the new index      Example: --target_index "index-01"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: max_age - (duration)
docs.text: rollover after the maximum elapsed time from index creation is reached      Example: --max_age "5d"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: max_docs - (int)
docs.text: rollover after the specified maximum number of documents is reached      Example: --max_docs 500      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: max_size - (string)
docs.text: rollover when the index reaches a certain size.      Example: --max_size "5mb"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: max_primary_shard_size - (string)
docs.text: rollover when the largest primary shard in the index reaches a certain size      Example: --max_primary_shard_size "5mb"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: elasticsearch rollover "students" --target_index "index-01" --max_age "5d" --max_docs 500 --max_size "5mb" --max_primary_shard_size "5mb"

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "create" Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "index" Object ID target

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: elasticsearch search
docs.text: Search with a given query

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns search hits that match the query in the request

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch search
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--target <target>]
[--from <from>]
[--size <size>]
[--sort <sort>]
--query <query>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: target - (string)
docs.text: List of data streams, indices, and index aliases used to limit the request      Example: --target "students or _all"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: from - (int)
docs.text: Starting document offset      Example: --from 1      Default: 0      Attributes: optional

docs.title: size - (int)
docs.text: Defines the number of hits to return      Example: --size 1      Default: 10      Attributes: optional

docs.title: sort - (string)
docs.text: List of : pairs      Example: --sort ""name":"asc","age":"desc""      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Query string you wish to parse and use for filtering. Defined using Lucene query string syntax.      Example: --query "(new york city) OR (big apple)"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

! elasticsearch search --cluster "elastic-1" --target "my-index-000001" --query "user.id:kimchy"

docs.title: elasticsearch shrink-index
docs.text: Shrink an existing index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Shrinks an existing index into a new index with fewer primary shards

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch shrink-index
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<index>
    --target_index <target_index>
    [--shards <shards>]
[--replicas <replicas>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of the index to be shrunk      Example: "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: target_index - (string)
docs.text: Name for the shrunk index. This shouldn't already exist in the cluster      Example: --target_index "students-shrunk"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: shards - (int)
docs.text: Primary shard count in target index. Must be lesser and a factor of source index primary shards      Example: --shards 1      Default: 1      Attributes: optional

docs.title: replicas - (int)
docs.text: Replica count in target index      Example: --replicas 1      Default: 1      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x = ! elasticsearch shrink-index "testingindex" --target_index "shrunktestingindex" --shards 1
Output: 
{
"acknowledged": true,
"shards_acknowledged": true,
"index": "shrunktestingindex"
}

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "index" Object ID index

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: elasticsearch split-index
docs.text: Split an existing index

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Splits an existing index into a new index with more primary shards

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch split-index
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<index>
    --target_index <target_index>
    --shards <shards>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of the index to be split      Example: "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: target_index - (string)
docs.text: Name for the split index. This shouldn't already exist in the cluster      Example: --target_index "students-split"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: shards - (int)
docs.text: Primary shard count in target index. It must be higher and a multiple of source index primary shards      Example: --shards 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch split-index "my_source_index" --shards 2 --target_index "split_index_1"
Output: 
{
"acknowledged": true,
"shards_acknowledged": true,
"index": "splittestingindex"
}

docs.title: elasticsearch update-by-query
docs.text: Update documents that match the specified query

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update documents that match the specified query

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch update-by-query
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--query <query>
    [<index>]
[--async]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Query string you wish to parse and use for filtering. Defined using Lucene query string syntax.      Example: --query "(new york city) OR (big apple)"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Indices to close      Example: "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: async - (bool)
docs.text: Create a task instead of waiting for completion      Example: --async      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch update-by-query --query "user.id:kimchy"
Output: 
{
"took": 6,
"timed_out": false,
"total": 0,
"updated": 0,
"deleted": 0,
"batches": 0,
"version_conflicts": 0,
"noops": 0,
"retries": {
"bulk": 0,
"search": 0
},
"throttled_millis": 0,
"requests_per_second": -1.0,
"throttled_until_millis": 0,
"failures": []
}

docs.title: elasticsearch update-cluster-settings
docs.text: update elastic search cluster settings

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update cluster-wide settings. Settings can be persistent(apply across restarts) or transient(don’t survive a full cluster restart)

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch update-cluster-settings
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--transient <transient>]
[--persistent <persistent>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: transient - (string)
docs.text: Transient settings to be updated      Example: --transient "{"indices.recovery.max_bytes_per_sec" : "20mb"}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: persistent - (string)
docs.text: Persistent settings to be updated      Example: --persistent "{"indices.recovery.max_bytes_per_sec" : "20mb"}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch update-cluster-settings --cluster "elastic-1" --persistent `{"indices.recovery.max_bytes_per_sec" : "20mb"}`
Output: 
{
"acknowledged": true,
"persistent": {
"indices": {
"recovery": {
"max_bytes_per_sec": "20mb"
}
}
},
"transient": {}
}

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "cluster" Object ID

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: elasticsearch update-document
docs.text: update elastic search document

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update a document using the specified script

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch update-document
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--index <index>
    <id>
    [--script <script>]
[--params <params>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of the index      Example: --index "students"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: id - (int)
docs.text: Unique identifier of the document.      Example: 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: script - (string)
docs.text: Script to be executed on document      Example: --script "ctx._source.new_field = 'value_of_new_field' or ctx._source.counter += params.count or ctx._source.tags.add(params.tag)"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: params - (string)
docs.text: Params that are used in source      Example: --params "{"count" : 4, "tag": "blue"}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x = ! elasticsearch update-document --cluster "elastic-1" --index "my-index-000001" 2 --script "ctx._source.new_field = params.count" --params `{"count" : 4}`
Output: 
{
"_index": "my-index-000001",
"_type": "_doc",
"_id": "2",
"_version": 4,
"result": "updated",
"_shards": {
"total": 2,
"s  uccessful": 1,
"failed": 0
},
"_seq_no": 7,
"_primary_term": 1
}

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:

docs.title: elasticsearch update-index-settings
docs.text: update elastic search index settings

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Changes settings for indices

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
elasticsearch update-index-settings
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[<index>]
[--settings <settings>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of elastic search cluster      Example: --cluster "elastic-default"      Default: elastic-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: index - (string)
docs.text: Name of indices (supports wild card expression)      Example: "students,class or _all or log_2099_*"      Default: _all      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: settings - (string)
docs.text: Map of settings to update in indices. Set a property to null to revert it to default setting      Example: --settings "{ "index.refresh_interval" : null, "index.number_of_replicas" : 1 }"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! elasticsearch update-index-settings --cluster "elastic-1" "class" "test" --settings `{"index.number_of_replicas": 1}`
Output: 
{
"acknowledged": true
}

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "elasticsearch" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "index" Object ID index

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: gcp create-bucket
docs.text: Create bucket

docs.title: Description
docs.text: create bucket in cloud storage

docs.text:
gcp create-bucket
    [--site <site>]
[<name>]
[--project <project>]
[--location <location>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Bucket name to create metric      Example: "bucket-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: project - (string)
docs.text: Project name to create bucket      Example: --project "project-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: location - (string)
docs.text: Location of the bucket      Example: --location "US"      Default: US      Attributes: optional

docs.title: labels - (string)
docs.text: Labels are the bucket's labels.      Example: --labels "{"owner":"user1"}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples

docs.title: gcp create-log-metric
docs.text: Create log metric

docs.title: Description
docs.text: create log metric for gcp logs

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
gcp create-log-metric
    [--site <site>]
[<name>]
[--description <description>]
[--filter <filter>]
[--disabled]
[--log_name <log_name>]
[--severity <severity>]
[--filter <filter>]
[--start_time <start_time>]
[--end_time <end_time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Metric name to create metric      Example: "CassandraMetric"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: Description for the metric      Example: --description "Metric details for Cassandra"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter - (string)
docs.text: A filter that chooses which log entries to create metric for      Example: --filter "resource.type=gae_app AND severity>=ERROR"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: disabled - (bool)
docs.text: If set to True, then this metric is disabled and it does not generate any points      Example: --disabled      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: log_name - (string)
docs.text: log names to filter out the logs      Example: --log_name "projects/macro-context-293714/logs/GCEGuestAgent"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: severity - (string)
docs.text:
Severity of the logs      Example: --severity "INFO"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

     Validation:          allowed values: DEFAULT, DEBUG, INFO, NOTICE, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL, ALERT, EMERGENCY

docs.title: filter - (string)
docs.text: A filter that chooses which log entries to return      Example: --filter "resource.type=gae_app AND severity>=ERROR"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start_time - (time)
docs.text: The time stamp indicating the earliest data to be returned      Example: --start_time "60m ago"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (time)
docs.text: The time stamp indicating the latest data to be returned      Example: --end_time "now"      Default: now      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x=! gcp create-log-metric "testMetric3" --description "testDesc" --filter "protoPayload.status >= 400 AND sample(insertId, 0.1)"
Output: 
{
"metric": {
"name": "testMetric3",
"description": "testDesc",
"filter": "protoPayload.status >= 400 AND sample(insertId, 0.1)",
"createTime": "2022-10-14T08:33:18.198693597Z",
"updateTime": "2022-10-14T08:33:18.198693597Z"
}
}
Input: 
! gcp create-log-metric "testMetric5" --description "testDesc" --filter "protoPayload.status >= 400 AND sample(insertId, 0.1)"
Output: 
NAME            DESCRIPTION     FILTER 
testMetric2     testDesc        severity="INFO"

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:

Field Value Action "create" Service Type "gcp" Service Instance Namespace Object Type "metric" Object ID name

docs.title: gcp get-logs
docs.text: Get logs

docs.title: Description
docs.text: get gcp logs

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
gcp get-logs
    [--site <site>]
[--resource_type <resource_type>]
[--resource_labels <resource_labels>]
[--log_name <log_name>]
[--severity <severity>]
[--count <count>]
[--filter <filter>]
[--start_time <start_time>]
[--end_time <end_time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: resource_type - (string)
docs.text: Types of one or more parent resources from which to retrieve log entries      Example: --resource_type "gae_app"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: resource_labels - (string)
docs.text: labels for this resource      Example: --resource_labels "resource_labels-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: log_name - (string)
docs.text: log names to filter out the logs      Example: --log_name "projects/macro-context-293714/logs/GCEGuestAgent"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: severity - (string)
docs.text:
Severity of the logs      Example: --severity "INFO"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

     Validation:          allowed values: DEFAULT, DEBUG, INFO, NOTICE, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL, ALERT, EMERGENCY

docs.title: count - (int)
docs.text: The maximum number of results to return from this request      Example: --count 100      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: filter - (string)
docs.text: A filter that chooses which log entries to return      Example: --filter "resource.type=gae_app AND severity>=ERROR"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start_time - (time)
docs.text: The time stamp indicating the earliest data to be returned      Example: --start_time "60m ago"      Default: 60m ago      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (time)
docs.text: The time stamp indicating the latest data to be returned      Example: --end_time "now"      Default: now      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x=! gcp get-logs --severity "INFO"

docs.text:
GitHub Commands

SubCommands:

• add-issue-comment: Add a comment to a github issue

• create-issue: Create github issue

• edit-issue: Edit github issue

• get-issue: Get github issue

• list-issues: List github issues

• search-issues: Search github issues

docs.title: github add-issue-comment
docs.text: Add a comment to a github issue

docs.title: Description

    [--site <site>]

docs.title: github list-issues
docs.text: List github issues

docs.title: Description
docs.text: List github issues

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
github list-issues
    [--site <site>]
--repo <repo>
    [--milestone <milestone>]
[--state <state>]
[--assignee <assignee>]
[--creator <creator>]
[--mentioned <mentioned>]
[--labels <labels>]
[--sort <sort>]
[--direction <direction>]
[--since <since>]
[--per_page <per_page>]
[--page <page>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: repo - (string)
docs.text: Fully Qualified Repository Name for issue      Example: --repo "github_user1/test_repo_1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: milestone - (string)
docs.text: The number of the milestone to associate this issue with.      Example: --milestone "milestone1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: state - (string)
docs.text: State of the issue. Either open or closed.      Example: --state "open"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: assignee - (string)
docs.text: Can be the name of a user. Pass in none for issues with no assigned user, and * for issues assigned to any user.      Example: --assignee "assignee"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: creator - (string)
docs.text: The user that created the issue.      Example: --creator "github_user1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: mentioned - (string)
docs.text: A user that is mentioned in the issue.      Example: --mentioned "github_user1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: labels - (string)
docs.text: A list of comma separated label names.      Example: --labels "bug,ui,@high"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: sort - (string)
docs.text: What to sort results by. Default- created      Example: --sort "created/updated/comments"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: direction - (string)
docs.text: One of asc (ascending) or desc (descending). Default- desc      Example: --direction "asc/desc"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: since - (time)
docs.text: Only show notifications updated after the given time      Example: --since "1 day ago"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: per_page - (int)
docs.text: Results per page (max 100). Default - 30      Example: --per_page 100      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: page - (int)
docs.text: Page number of the results to fetch. Default - 1      Example: --page 2      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: direction - (string)

docs.title: page - (int)

                "repos_url": "https://api.github.com/users/craigcook/repos",
                "events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/craigcook/events{/privacy}",
                "received_events_url": "https://api.github.com/users/craigcook/received_events",
                "type": "User",
                "site_admin": false
            },
            "labels": [],
            "state": "open",
            "locked": false,
            "assignee": null,
            "assignees": [],
            "milestone": null,
            "comments": 0,
            "created_at": "2022-06-07T01:00:43Z",
            "updated_at": "2022-06-07T01:00:43Z",
            "closed_at": null,
            "author_association": "MEMBER",
            "active_lock_reason": null,
            "body": "We've deprecated the Hero component in favor of Split (for Hero with image) or Callout (for Hero without an image). However, Callout in its current state isn't actually an adequate replacement for the non-image, centered Hero without some modifications.\r
\r
Namely:\r
- Callout has built-in logos. We should instead prefer the newer Logo/Wordmark components (however we first need to make Logos and Wordmarks centerable, see #718 which would be a blocker for this).\r
- Hero has a max-width of 580px on its content; Callout contains an `mzp-l-content` container with a max-width of 800px, which breaks from the standard container widths. Callout should support the standard container widths.\r
- The Callout title has a set size, a bit smaller than the Hero title, since it wasn't designed to be a page title. Instead of a set size for the title we could instead use utility classes for title sizes.\r
\r
We could make all these changes to the Callout component **OR** we could create a new component with the properties we want and deprecate Callout entirely. \r
\r
I'm leaning toward deprecation mainly because some of these would be breaking changes, especially removing the built-in logos. But if we make a new component and add a deprecation warning for Callout that would allow people more time to transition.\r
\r
A new, content-agnostic, centered section with some spacing, standardized content widths, and an optional background color could replace a centered Hero as well as anywhere else we currently use Callout.\r
\r
",

            "body": "## Description\r
\r
Got this via email from Netlify:\r
\r
```\r
Deprecation notice: Netlify builds using the Trusty build image will fail after September 19\r
\r
The Netlify build system maintains multiple build images, which set the environment in which your sites build. One or more of your sites is using the “Trusty” image, built on Ubuntu 14.04 (“Trusty Tahr”). The Trusty image moved into legacy support in 2019, after Ubuntu 14.04 reached end of life.\r
\r
On September 19, 2021, we will end all support for the Netlify Trusty image.\r
```\r
\r
Migration guide here: https://answers.netlify.com/t/please-read-end-of-support-for-trusty-build-image-everything-you-need-to-know/39004\r

docs.title: gitlab
docs.text:
GitLab Commands

SubCommands:

• create-discussion: Create new discussion for gitlab issue

• create-issue: Create gitlab issue

• edit-issue: Edit gitlab issue

• list-issues: List gitlab issue

docs.title: gitlab create-discussion
docs.text: Create new discussion for gitlab issue

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create new discussion for gitlab issue

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
gitlab create-discussion
    [--site <site>]
--project <project>
    --issue <issue>
    <body>
    [--created_at <created_at>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: project - (string)
docs.text: The path of the project      Example: --project "saiprakash_maira/testing"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: issue - (integer)
docs.text: The IID of an issue      Example: --issue "1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: body - (string)
docs.text: The content of the thread      Example: "discussion_here"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: created_at - (time)
docs.text: time at which issue was created      Example: --created_at "1 day ago"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x = ! gitlab create-discussion --project "saiprakash_maira/testing" --issue 4 "hello discussion 2"

docs.title: gitlab create-issue
docs.text: Create gitlab issue

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create gitlab issue

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
gitlab create-issue
    [--site <site>]
--title <title>
    --assignee <assignee>
    [--confidential]
[--created_at <created_at>]
[--description <description>]
[--discussion_to_resolve <discussion_to_resolve>]
[--due_date <due_date>]
[--epic_id <epic_id>]
--project <project>
    [--issue <issue>]
[--issue_type <issue_type>]
[--labels <labels>]
[--weight <weight>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: title - (string)
docs.text: Title of an issue      Example: --title "issue1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: assignee - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the user to assign the issue to. Only appears on GitLab Free.      Example: --assignee "1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: confidential - (bool)
docs.text: Set an issue to be confidential. Default is false.      Example: --confidential      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: created_at - (time)
docs.text: When the issue was created. Requires administrator or project/group owner rights.      Example: --created_at "1 day ago"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: The description of an issue. Limited to 1,048,576 characters.      Example: --description "issue1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: discussion_to_resolve - (string)
docs.text: The ID of a discussion to resolve. This fills out the issue with a default description and mark the discussion as resolved. Use in combination with merge_request_to_resolve_discussions_of.      Example: --discussion_to_resolve "1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: due_date - (string)
docs.text: The due date. Date time string in the format YYYY-MM-DD      Example: --due_date "2016-03-11"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: epic_id - (int)
docs.text: ID of the epic to add the issue to. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.      Example: --epic_id 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: project - (string)
docs.text: The path of the project owned by the authenticated user .      Example: --project "saiprakash_maira/testing"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: issue - (int)
docs.text: The internal ID of the project’s issue (requires administrator or project owner rights)      Example: --issue 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: issue_type - (string)
docs.text: The type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case. Default is issue.      Example: --issue_type "issue"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: labels - (string)
docs.text: Label names for an issue      Example: --labels "label"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: weight - (int)
docs.text: The weight of the issue. Valid values are greater than or equal to 0.      Example: --weight 10      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! gitlab create-issue --project "saiprakash_maira/testing" --title "new_issue" --assignee saiprakash_maira --description "testing" --due_date "2021-12-12"

docs.title: created_at - (time)

docs.title: issue - (int)

docs.title: issue_type - (string)
docs.text: The type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case. Default is issue.      Example: --issue_type "issue"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: labels - (string)

docs.title: remove_labels - (string)

docs.title: state_event - (string)
docs.text:
The state event of an issue. Set close to close the issue and reopen to reopen it      Example: --state_event "reopen"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: updated_at - (time)

docs.title: assignee - (string)
docs.text: Return issues assigned to the given username. Similar to assignee_id and mutually exclusive with assignee_id. In GitLab CE, the assignee_username array should only contain a single value. Otherwise, an invalid parameter error is returned.      Example: --assignee "myname"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: author - (string)
docs.text: Return issues created by the given username. Similar to author_id and mutually exclusive with author_id.      Example: --author "author_name"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: confidential - (bool)
docs.text: Filter confidential or public issues.      Example: --confidential      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: created_after - (time)
docs.text: Return issues created on or after the given time      Example: --created_after "1 day ago"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: created_before - (time)
docs.text: Return issues created on or before the given time      Example: --created_before "now"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: due_date - (string)
docs.text:
Return issues that have no due date, are overdue, or whose due date is this week, this month, or between two weeks ago and next month. Accepts 0 (no due date), overdue, week, month, next_month_and_previous_two_weeks.      Example: --due_date "overdue"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: 0, overdue, week, month, next_month_and_previous_two_weeks

docs.title: issues - (int)
docs.text: Return only the issues having the given iid      Example: --issues 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: issue_type - (string)
docs.text:
Filter to a given type of issue. One of issue, incident, or test_case.      Example: --issue_type "test_case"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: issue, incident, test_case

docs.title: iteration_title - (string)
docs.text: Return issues assigned to the iteration with the given title. Similar to iteration_id and mutually exclusive with iteration_id.      Example: --iteration_title "title"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: labels - (string)
docs.text: Label names, issues must have all labels to be returned. None lists all issues with no labels. Any lists all issues with at least one label. Predefined names are case-insensitive.      Example: --labels "label"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: non_archived - (bool)
docs.text: Return issues only from non-archived projects. If false, the response returns issues from both archived and non-archived projects. Default is true.      Example: --non_archived      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: order_by - (string)
docs.text:
Return issues ordered by created_at, due_date, label_priority, milestone_due, popularity, priority, relative_position, title, updated_at, or weight fields. Default is created_at.      Example: --order_by "created_at"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: created_at, due_date, label_priority, milestone_due, popularity, priority, relative_position, title, updated_at, weight

docs.title: scope - (string)
docs.text:
Return issues for the given scope - created_by_me, assigned_to_me or all. Defaults to created_by_me      Example: --scope "created_by_me"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: created_by_me, assigned_to_me, all

docs.title: search - (string)
docs.text: Search issues against their title and description      Example: --search "title"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: sort - (string)
docs.text:
Return issues sorted in asc or desc order. Default is desc      Example: --sort "asc"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: asc, desc

docs.title: state - (string)
docs.text:
Return all issues or just those that are opened or closed      Example: --state "opened"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: opened, closed

docs.title: updated_after - (time)
docs.text: Return issues updated on or after the given time.      Example: --updated_after "1 day ago"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: updated_before - (time)
docs.text: Return issues updated on or before the given time.      Example: --updated_before "1 day ago"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: weight - (int)
docs.text: Return issues with the specified weight. None returns issues with no weight assigned. Any returns issues with a weight assigned.      Example: --weight 10      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: with_labels_details - (bool)
docs.text: If true, the response returns more details for each label in labels field: :name, :color, :description, :description_html, :text_color. Default is false.      Example: --with_labels_details      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!gitlab list-issues --project "gitlab-com/sales-team/field-operations/sales-operations"
Output: 
NUMBER  LABELS                          STATE   ASSIGNEES       MILESTONE                           TITLE
