docs.title: icinga
docs.text:
Icinga Commands

SubCommands:

• create-check-command: Creates a new check command object

• create-host: Creates a new host object

• create-service: Creates a new service object

• delete-object: deletes object

• modify-check-command: modifies a check command object

• modify-host: modifies a host object

• modify-service: modifies a service object

• query-configuration-objects: Returns information about configuration objects

docs.title: icinga create-check-command
docs.text: Creates a new check command object

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a new check command object

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
icinga create-check-command
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--name <name>
    [--templates <templates>]
[--ignore_on_err]
--commands <commands>
    [--arguments <arguments>]
[--vars <vars>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of Icinga cluster      Example: --cluster "icinga-default"      Default: icinga-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Name of the check command object. Must be unique on a per-host basis      Example: --name "checkcommand1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: templates - (string)
docs.text: Import existing configuration templates for this object type. These templates must either be statically configured or provided in config packages      Example: --templates "plugin-check-command"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: ignore_on_err - (bool)
docs.text: If set, Ignore object creation errors and return an HTTP 200 status instead.      Example: --ignore_on_err      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: commands - (string)
docs.text: The command. This can either be an array of individual command arguments. Alternatively a string can be specified in which case the shell interpreter (usually /bin/sh) takes care of parsing the command.      Example: --commands "/usr/local/sbin/check_http"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: arguments - (string)
docs.text: A dictionary of command arguments      Example: --arguments "{ "-I": "$mytest_iparam$" }"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: vars - (string)
docs.text: A dictionary containing custom variables that are specific to this command.      Example: --vars "{http_ssl: false, http_sni: false}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! icinga create-check-command --name "ccmd1" --commands "/usr/local/sbin/check_http"
Output: 
{
"results": [
{
"code": 200,
"status": "Object was created"
}
]
}

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "create" Service Type "icinga" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "check_command" Object ID name

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: icinga create-host
docs.text: Creates a new host object

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a new host object

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
icinga create-host
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--name <name>
    [--templates <templates>]
[--ignore_on_err]
[--address <address>]
[--groups <groups>]
[--vars <vars>]
--check_command <check_command>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of Icinga cluster      Example: --cluster "icinga-default"      Default: icinga-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Name of the host object      Example: --name "example.localdomain"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: templates - (string)
docs.text: Import existing configuration templates for this object type. These templates must either be statically configured or provided in config packages      Example: --templates "generic-host"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: ignore_on_err - (bool)
docs.text: If set, Ignore object creation errors and return an HTTP 200 status instead.      Example: --ignore_on_err      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: address - (string)
docs.text: The host’s IPv4 address. Available as command runtime macro $address$ if set.      Example: --address "192.168.1.1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: groups - (string)
docs.text: A list of host groups this host belongs to      Example: --groups "group1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: vars - (string)
docs.text: A dictionary containing custom variables that are specific to this host.      Example: --vars "{"os":"linux"}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: check_command - (string)
docs.text: The name of the check command.      Example: --check_command "hostalive"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! icinga create-host --cluster "icinga-default" --name "host1" --templates "generic-host" --ignore_on_err --address "192.168.5.96" --check_command "hostalive" --vars `{"os":"linux"}`
Output: 
{
"results": [
{
"code": 200,
"status": "Object was created"
}
]
}

icinga create-service
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]

[--ignore_on_err]
--host_name <host_name>
    [--groups <groups>]
[--vars <vars>]

docs.title: site - (string)

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Name of the service object. Must be unique on a per-host basis      Example: --name "service1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: templates - (string)
docs.text: Import existing configuration templates for this object type. These templates must either be statically configured or provided in config packages      Example: --templates "generic-service"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: ignore_on_err - (bool)
docs.text: If set, Ignore object creation errors and return an HTTP 200 status instead.      Example: --ignore_on_err      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.text: The host this service belongs to. There must be a Host object with that name.      Example: --host_name "host1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: groups - (string)
docs.text: A list of service groups this service belongs to      Example: --groups "group1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: vars - (string)
docs.text: A dictionary containing custom variables that are specific to this service.      Example: --vars "{"snmp_community":"public", "snmp_oid":"DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::sysUpTimeInstance"}"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: check_command - (string)
docs.text: The name of the check command.      Example: --check_command "snmp"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! icinga create-service --name "service1" --host_name "host1" --check_command "snmp" --vars `{"snmp_community":"public", "snmp_oid":"DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::sysUpTimeInstance"}`
Output:

"results": [
{
"code": 200,
"status": "Object was created"
}
]
}

docs.title: icinga delete-object
docs.text: deletes object

docs.title: Description
docs.text: deletes object

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
icinga delete-object
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--name <name>
    --object_type <object_type>
    [--cascade <cascade>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of Icinga cluster      Example: --cluster "icinga-default"      Default: icinga-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Name of the object. Must be unique on a per-host basis      Example: --name "checkcommand1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: object_type - (string)
docs.text: Type of object      Example: --object_type "hosts, services"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: cascade - (boolean)
docs.text: Delete objects depending on the deleted objects (e.g. services on a host).      Example: --cascade "cascade-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: icinga delete-object --name "checkcommand1" --object_type "hosts, services" --cascade "cascade-1"

docs.title: icinga query-configuration-objects
docs.text: Returns information about configuration objects

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns information about configuration objects

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
icinga query-configuration-objects
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--type <type>]
[--name <name>]
[--attrs <attrs>]
[--joins <joins>]
[--meta <meta>]
[--filters <filters>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of Icinga cluster      Example: --cluster "icinga-default"      Default: icinga-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: Type of configuration object. Used to limit the objects returned in the response to a certain type of object      Example: --type "hosts/ services"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Object name to query for a single object      Example: --name "example.localdomain"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: attrs - (string)
docs.text: Attribute list of object to limit output      Example: --attrs "name/ address"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: joins - (string)
docs.text: Join related object types and their attributes specified as list      Example: --joins "host"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: meta - (string)
docs.text: Enable meta information      Example: --meta "meta=used_by (references from other objects), meta=location (location information) specified as list"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: filters - (string)
docs.text: Used to return objects that only match the provided criteria      Example: --filters "service.acknowledgement_expiry==0, service.downtime_depth == 0.0"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: jira
docs.text:
Jira Commands

SubCommands:

• add-issue-comment: Add comment to issue

• add-issue-labels: Add label to issue.

• add-vote: Adds the user's vote to an issue.

• add-watcher: Adds the watcher to an issue.

• archive-project: Archive a project.

• assign-issue: Assign issue to user

• clone-issue: clones the issue to same project

• copy-attachments: Copy attachments to another issue.

• create-custom-field: Creates a custom field.

• create-issue: Create Jira Issue.

• create-project: Creates a project based on a project type template.

• create-project-version: create a new version of project.

• create-user: Creates a user.

• create-workflow: Creates a workflow. If no transitional rules are specified the default system transition rules are used.

• delete-attachment: Deletes attachment using attachmentId.

• delete-issue: Deletes an issue

• delete-issue-comment: Delete comment to issue

• delete-project: Delete a project.

• delete-user: Deletes a user.

• delete-vote: Deletes user's votes on an issue.

• delete-watcher: delete watcher using accountId for an issue.

• delete-workflow: Deletes an inactive workflow.

• get-all-workflows: Returns a paginated list of published classic workflows. When workflow names are specified, details of those workflows are returned.

• get-all-workflows-transition-rule-configuration: Returns a paginated list of workflows with transition rules.

• get-attachment: Gets attachment from attachmentId.

• get-fields: Returns system and custom issue fields provide issue for .

• get-issue: Returns the details for an issue

• get-issue-changelogs: Returns a paginated list of all changelogs for an issue sorted by date.

• get-issue-comment: Get comment to issue

• get-issue-labels: Get label from issue / All labels.

• get-permissions: Returns all/uers's permissions.

• get-project: Returns project visible to the user.

• get-project-version-issues-count: Returns a issue count of project version.

• get-project-version-unresolved-issue-count: Returns a issue count of project version.

• get-project-versions: Returns a list of project versions.

• get-users: Returns a list of all users (active, inactive and deleted users) .

• get-vote: Returns details about the votes on an issue.

• get-watcher: Returns the watchers for an issue.

• list-issue-types: List all issue types for user / project

• list-issues: List all issues for project

• list-projects: Returns all projects visible to the user.

• list-recent-projects: Returns a list of up to 20 projects recently viewed by the user.

• merge-project-versions: Merge two version of project.

• remove-issue-labels: Remove label from issue.

• restore-deleted-project: Restores a project that has been archived or placed in the Jira recycle bin.

• update-custom-field: Updates a custom field.

• update-issue: update issues for project

• update-issue-comment: Update comment to issue

• update-project: Update a project based on a project type template.

• update-project-version: Update a version of project.

docs.title: jira create-project-version
docs.text: create a new version of project.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: create a new version of project.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira create-project-version
    --site <site>
    [--description <description>]
--name <name>
    [--archived]
[--released]
[--expand <expand>]
<project>
    [--move_unfixed_issues_to <move_unfixed_issues_to>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: The description of the version.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text:
The unique name of the version. Required when creating a version.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

     Validation:          max length: 255

docs.title: archived - (bool)
docs.text: Indicates that the version is archived.      Example: --archived      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: released - (bool)
docs.text: Indicates that the version is released. If the version is released a request to release again is ignored. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.      Example: --released      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: expand - (string)
docs.text: This parameter accepts operations, which returns actions that can be performed on the version.      Example: --expand "expand-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: project - (string)
docs.text: The project ID (case sensitive)      Example: "project-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: move_unfixed_issues_to - (string)
docs.text: The URL of the self link to the version to which all unfixed issues are moved when a version is released. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.      Example: --move_unfixed_issues_to "move_unfixed_issues_to-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira create-project-version --description "description-1" --name "name-1" --archived --released --expand "expand-1" "project-1" --move_unfixed_issues_to "move_unfixed_issues_to-1"

docs.title: jira create-project
docs.text: Creates a project based on a project type template.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a project based on a project type template.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira create-project
    --site <site>
    --key <key>
    --name <name>
    [--description <description>]
--lead <lead>
    [--url <url>]
[--default_assignee <default_assignee>]
[--avatar <avatar>]
[--issue_security_scheme <issue_security_scheme>]
[--permission_scheme <permission_scheme>]
[--notification_scheme <notification_scheme>]
[--category <category>]
--project_type <project_type>
    --project_template <project_template>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: key - (string)
docs.text:
Project keys. The maximum length is 10 characters.      Example: --key "key-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

     Validation:          max length: 10

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the project.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: description of the project.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: lead - (string)
docs.text:
The account ID of the project lead.      Example: --lead "lead-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

     Validation:          max length: 128

docs.title: url - (string)
docs.text: A link to information about this project, such as project documentation      Example: --url "url-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: default_assignee - (string)
docs.text:
The default assignee when creating issues for this project.      Example: --default_assignee "default_assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: PROJECT_LEAD, UNASSIGNED

docs.title: avatar - (int)
docs.text: An integer value for the project's avatar.      Example: --avatar 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: issue_security_scheme - (int)
docs.text: ID of the issue security scheme, which enables you to control who can view issues.      Example: --issue_security_scheme 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: permission_scheme - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the permission scheme for the project.      Example: --permission_scheme "permission_scheme-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: notification_scheme - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the notification scheme for the project.      Example: --notification_scheme 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: category - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the project's category.      Example: --category 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: project_type - (string)
docs.text:
Project type defines the application-specific feature set.      Example: --project_type "project_type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

     Validation:          allowed values: software, service_desk, business

docs.title: project_template - (string)
docs.text:

docs.title: jira create-workflow
docs.text: Creates a workflow. If no transitional rules are specified the default system transition rules are used.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a workflow. If no transitional rules are specified the default system transition rules are used.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira create-workflow
    --site <site>
    --workflow <workflow>
    [--description <description>]
--name <name>
    --from <from>
    --to <to>
    --type <type>
    [--statuses <statuses>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: workflow - (string)
docs.text: Name of workflow      Example: --workflow "workflow-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: Description of the workflow      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: name for transitions      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: from - (string)
docs.text: from for transitions      Example: --from "from-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: to - (string)
docs.text: to for transitions      Example: --to "to-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: type for transitions      Example: --type "type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: statuses - (string)
docs.text: Statuses made by the workflow      Example: --statuses "statuses-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira create-workflow --workflow "workflow-1" --description "description-1" --name "name-1" --from "from-1" --to "to-1" --type "type-1" --statuses "statuses-1"

docs.title: jira get-users
docs.text: Returns a list of all users (active, inactive and deleted users) .

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns a list of all users (active, inactive and deleted users) .

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira get-users
    --site <site>
    [<user>]
[--expand <expand>]
[--start_index <start_index>]
[--max <max>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: user - (string)
docs.text:
The account ID of the user      Example: "user-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          max length: 128

docs.title: expand - (string)
docs.text:
Use expand to include additional information about users in the response.      Example: --expand "expand-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: groups, applicationRoles

docs.title: start_index - (int)
docs.text: The index of the first item to return.      Example: --start_index 1      Default: 0      Attributes: optional

docs.title: max - (int)
docs.text: The maximum number of items to return per page.      Example: --max 1      Default: 50      Attributes: optional

!jira get-users

5cb4ae0e4b97ab11a18e00c7                    Atlassian Assist                app         true    
60e5a86a471e61006a4c51fd                    Microsoft Teams for Jira Cloud  app         true    
557058:0867a421-a9ee-4659-801a-bc0ee4a4487e Slack                           app         true    
557058:950f9f5b-3d6d-4e1d-954a-21367ae9ac75 Jira Service Management Widget  app         true    
5dd64082af96bc0efbe55103                    Opsgenie Integration            app         true    
557058:214cdd6a-ff93-4d8b-838b-62dfcf1a2a71 Trello                          app         true    
5b6c7b3afbc68529c6c47967                    Statuspage for Jira             app         true    
5cf112d31552030f1e3a5905                    Jira Spreadsheets               app         true

docs.text:

ID      NAME        DESCRIPTION                                                                 SCOPE 
10006   Sub-task    A small piece of work that's part of a larger task.                         -

10005   Task        A small, distinct piece of work.                                            -       
10007   New Feature A new feature of the product, which has yet to be developed.                -       
10008   Bug         A problem or error.                                                         -       
10009   Story       Created by Jira Agile - do not edit or delete. Issue type for a user story. -       
10000   Epic        A collection of related bugs, stories, and tasks.                           -

!jira list-issue-types --project "10002"
Output: 
ID      NAME        DESCRIPTION                                                     SCOPE 
10004   Improvement An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.   -       
10005   Task        A small, distinct piece of work.                                -

docs.title: jira update-project-version
docs.text: Update a version of project.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update a version of project.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira update-project-version
    --site <site>
    <version>
    [--description <description>]
[--name <name>]
[--archived]
[--released]
[--expand <expand>]
[--move_unfixed_issues_to <move_unfixed_issues_to>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: version - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the version.      Example: "version-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: The description of the version. Optional when creating or updating a version.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text:
The unique name of the version. Required when creating a version.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          max length: 255

docs.title: archived - (bool)
docs.text: Indicates that the version is archived. Optional when creating or updating a version.      Example: --archived      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: released - (bool)
docs.text: Indicates that the version is released. If the version is released a request to release again is ignored.      Example: --released      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: expand - (string)
docs.text: This parameter accepts operations, which returns actions that can be performed on the version.      Example: --expand "expand-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: move_unfixed_issues_to - (string)
docs.text: The URL of the self link to the version to which all unfixed issues are moved when a version is released. Not applicable when creating a version. Optional when updating a version.      Example: --move_unfixed_issues_to "move_unfixed_issues_to-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira update-project-version "version-1" --description "description-1" --name "name-1" --archived --released --expand "expand-1" --move_unfixed_issues_to "move_unfixed_issues_to-1"

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "jira" Service Instance Namespace Object Type "project-version" Object ID version

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: jira update-project
docs.text: Update a project based on a project type template.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update a project based on a project type template.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
jira update-project
    --site <site>
    <project>
    [--expand <expand>]
--key <key>
    [--name <name>]
[--description <description>]
[--lead <lead>]
[--url <url>]
[--default_assignee <default_assignee>]
[--avatar <avatar>]
[--issue_security_scheme <issue_security_scheme>]
[--permission_scheme <permission_scheme>]
[--notification_scheme <notification_scheme>]
[--category <category>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Example: --site "site-1"      Default: localhost:8081      Attributes: required

docs.title: project - (string)
docs.text: The project ID (case sensitive)      Example: "project-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: expand - (string)
docs.text:
to include additional information in the response.      Example: --expand "expand-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: description, issueTypes, lead, projectKeys

docs.title: key - (string)
docs.text:
Project keys. The maximum length is 10 characters.      Example: --key "key-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

     Validation:          max length: 10

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the project.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: description of the project.      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: lead - (string)
docs.text:
The account ID of the project lead.      Example: --lead "lead-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          max length: 128

docs.title: url - (string)
docs.text: A link to information about this project, such as project documentation      Example: --url "url-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: default_assignee - (string)
docs.text:
The default assignee when creating issues for this project.      Example: --default_assignee "default_assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: PROJECT_LEAD, UNASSIGNED

docs.title: avatar - (int)
docs.text: An integer value for the project's avatar.      Example: --avatar 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: issue_security_scheme - (int)
docs.text: ID of the issue security scheme, which enables you to control who can view issues.      Example: --issue_security_scheme 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: permission_scheme - (string)
docs.text: The ID of the permission scheme for the project.      Example: --permission_scheme "permission_scheme-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: notification_scheme - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the notification scheme for the project.      Example: --notification_scheme 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: category - (int)
docs.text: The ID of the project's category.      Example: --category 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: jira update-project "project-1" --expand "expand-1" --key "key-1" --name "name-1" --description "description-1" --lead "lead-1" --url "url-1" --default_assignee "default_assignee-1" --avatar 1 --issue_security_scheme 1 --permission_scheme "permission_scheme-1" --notification_scheme 1 --category 1

docs.text:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "jira" Service Instance Namespace Object Type "project" Object ID project

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: junos
docs.text:
Junos Commands

SubCommands:

• ping: Ping remote target

• show-bgp-neighbor: Show overview of BGP information

• show-bgp-summary: Show overview of BGP information

• show-route: Show routing table information

docs.title: junos ping
docs.text: Ping remote target

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Ping remote target

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
junos ping
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<host>
    [--count <count>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of junos device      Example: --cluster "mx-1"      Default: junos-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: host - (string)
docs.text: Hostname or IP address of remote host      Example: "10.100.1.2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: count - (int)
docs.text: Number of ping requests to send      Example: --count 3      Default: 3      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!junos ping "10.100.14.2" --count 3

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "read" Service Type "junos" Service Instance Namespace Object Type "ping" Object ID

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: junos show-bgp-neighbor
docs.text: Show overview of BGP information

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Show overview of BGP information

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
junos show-bgp-neighbor
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[<neighbor>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of junos device      Example: --cluster "mx-1"      Default: junos-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: neighbor - (string)
docs.text: Show the neighbor database for a particular neighbor      Example: "10.100.1.2"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

!junos show-bgp-neighbor "10.100.14.2"

  Peer does not support LLGR Restarter functionality

  Peer does not support Addpath

    Send state: in sync

docs.title: junos show-bgp-summary
docs.text: Show overview of BGP information

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Show overview of BGP information

docs.title: Synopsis

junos show-bgp-summary

[--cluster <cluster>]

docs.title: k8s create-job
docs.text: create job

docs.title: Description
docs.text: create job

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
k8s create-job
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--namespace|-n <namespace>]
[--image <image>]
[--command <command>]
[--command_args <command_args>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Cluster where this command will be executed      Example: --cluster "in-cluster"      Default: in-cluster      Attributes: optional

docs.title: namespace - (string)
docs.text: Kubernetes namespace      Example: --namespace "namespace-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: image - (string)
docs.text: Image name for this job      Example: --image "perl"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: command - (string)
docs.text: Command for this job      Example: --command "perl"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: command_args - (string)
docs.text: arg for the command      Example: --command_args "-Mbignum=bpi"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

!k8s create-job --image "busybox" --command "/bin/sh" --command_args "-c" --command_args "date; echo Hello from the Kubernetes cluster"
Output: 
{
"cluster": "in-cluster",
"namespace": "default",
"name": "default",
"annotations": {
"autopilot.gke.io/resource-adjustment": "{\"input\":{\"containers\":[{\"name\":\"default\"}]},\"output\":{\"containers\":[{\"limits\":{\"cpu\":\"500m\",\"ephemeral-storage\":\"1Gi\",\"memory\":\"2Gi\"},\"requests\":{\"cpu\":\"500m\",\"ephemeral-storage\":\"1Gi\",\"memory\":\"2Gi\"},\"name\":\"default\"}]},\"modified\":true}"
},
"labels": {
"controller-uid": "1d962783-7c37-4701-af34-3527447858aa",
"job-name": "default"
}
}

docs.title: k8s get-pod-logs
docs.text: Get k8s pod logs

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get logs from kubernetes pods

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
k8s get-pod-logs
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--namespace|-n <namespace>]
<name>
    [--since <since>]
[--since_time <since_time>]
[--tail_lines <tail_lines>]
[--limit_bytes <limit_bytes>]
[--label_selector <label_selector>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Cluster where this command will be executed      Example: --cluster "in-cluster"      Default: in-cluster      Attributes: optional

docs.title: namespace - (string)
docs.text: Kubernetes namespace      Example: --namespace "namespace-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: Name of the pod      Example: "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: since - (duration)
docs.text: Duration for which logs are required. Only one of since or since_time can be specified      Example: --since "5 seconds"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: since_time - (string)
docs.text: Timestamp from which logs required. Should follow RFC3339 standard      Example: --since_time "2019-10-12T07:20:50.52Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: tail_lines - (int)
docs.text: the number of lines from the end of the logs to show      Example: --tail_lines 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: limit_bytes - (int)
docs.text: the number of bytes to read from the server before terminating the log output      Example: --limit_bytes 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: label_selector - (string)
docs.text: label selector to select pods to get logs for. Only used if name is not provided      Example: --label_selector "app=myapp"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! k8s get-pod-logs "hello-1629338580-jw8sf"
Output: 
{
"logs": [
"Thu Aug 19 02:03:06 UTC 2021",
"Hello from the Kubernetes cluster",
""
]
}

docs.title: kafka
docs.text:
Kafka commands

SubCommands:

• add-consumer: Add kafka consumer

• alter-partition-assignments: Alter partition assignments

• alter-resource-config: Alter config of kafka resources

• create-consumer: Create kafka consumer

• create-partitions: Create partitions for kafka topic

• create-topic: create Kafka topic

• delete-topic: Delete kafka topic

• describe-topics: Describe kafka topics

• get-broker-config: Get Config for kafka broker Resource

• get-broker-metrics: Get Kafka Broker metrics

• get-brokers: get kafka brokers

• get-consumer-metrics: Get kafka consumer metrics

• get-leader: Get leader for Kafka topic partition

• get-offset: Get offset for Kafka topic partition

• get-producer-metrics: Get kafka producer metrics

• get-topic-config: Get Config for kafka Topic Resource

• get-topics: Get Kafka topics

• restart-consumer: Restart kafka consumer

• send-messages: Send messages to kafka topic

• send-receive-messages: Send messages to kafka topic and read with a comsumer

docs.title: kafka alter-resource-config

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Alters config of a given kafka resource

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka alter-resource-config
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--resource_name <resource_name>
    --resource_type <resource_type>
    <entries>
    [--validate_only]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: resource_name - (string)
docs.text: Can be topic name or broker id      Example: --resource_name "resource_name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: resource_type - (string)
docs.text: Values can either be "TopicResource" or "BrokerResource"      Example: --resource_type "resource_type-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: entries - (string)
docs.text: stringified Map with keys as config names and values as modified config values      Example: "entries-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: validate_only - (bool)
docs.text: Example: --validate_only      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka alter-resource-config --resource_type "TopicResource" --resource_name "test-topic-1" `{"file.delete.delay.ms":"10000", "delete.retention.ms":"1000000"}`
Output: 
Config for the resource test-topic-1 updated

docs.title: kafka create-consumer
docs.text: Create kafka consumer

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka create-consumer
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<consuming_topic>
    [--all_partitions]
[--partitions <partitions>]
[--offset_option <offset_option>]
[--offset_value <offset_value>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: consuming_topic - (string)
docs.text: Topic to be consumed      Example: "consuming_topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: all_partitions - (bool)
docs.text: boolean value to decide whether consumer should consume from all partitions      Example: --all_partitions      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: partitions - (int)
docs.text: partition number from which consumer should consume. Multiple partitions can be consumed      Example: --partitions 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: offset_option - (string)
docs.text: Value can be either "OLDEST" or "NEWEST"      Example: --offset_option "OLDEST" , --offset_option "NEWEST"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: offset_value - (int)
docs.text: offset from which messages are read in the provided partitions. Provide either offset_option or offset_value      Example: --offset_value 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka create-consumer "test-topic-1" --partitions 1 --offset_option "NEWEST"
Output: 
Consumer for the topic "test-topic-1" created

    [--site <site>]

docs.title: kafka get-broker-metrics
docs.text: Get Kafka Broker metrics

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get metrics for one broker or all kafka brokers combined

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-broker-metrics
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--broker <broker>]
[<beans>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: broker - (int)
docs.text: broker id      Example: --broker 1      Default: -1      Attributes: optional

docs.title: beans - ()
docs.text: list of beans      Example: "kafka.server"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x = ! kafka get-broker-metrics --broker 1 --beans "kafka.server"
Output: 
{
"brokerMetrics": [
{
"brokerId": 1,
"beanMetrics": [
{
"bean": "kafka.server",
"mbeanMetrics": [
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=KafkaServer,name=linux-disk-read-bytes",
"metrics": [
{
"attribute": "linux-disk-read-bytes",
"value": 22417408
}
]
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=KafkaServer,name=linux-disk-write-bytes",
"metrics": [
{
"attribute": "linux-disk-write-bytes",
"value": 11833344
}
]
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=ReplicaManager,name=*",
"metrics": [
{
"attribute": "PartitionCount",
"value": 3
},
{
"attribute": "LeaderCount",
"value": 2
},
{
"attribute": "AtMinIsrPartitionCount",
"value": 1
},
{
"attribute": "IsrExpands",
"value": 0.0001234603991556604
}
]
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=DelayedOperationPurgatory,name=PurgatorySize,delayedOperation=Produce",
"metrics": []
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=DelayedOperationPurgatory,name=PurgatorySize,delayedOperation=Fetch",
"metrics": [
{
"attribute": "PurgatorySize",
"value": 121
}
]
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=BrokerTopicMetrics,name=*",
"metrics": [
{
"attribute": "TotalFetchRequests",
"value": 1.9917576217462
}
]
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=KafkaRequestHandlerPool,name=RequestHandlerAvgIdlePercent",
"metrics": [
{
"attribute": "RequestHandlerAvgIdlePercentMeanRate",
"value": 0.9999090453002375
}
]
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=Produce",
"metrics": []
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=socket-server-metrics,listener={listener_name},networkProcessor={#},name=connection-count",
"metrics": []
},
{
"mbean": "kafka.server:type=socket-server-metrics,listener={listener_name},networkProcessor={#},name=connection-creation-rate",
"metrics": []
}
]
}
]
}
]
}
Input: 
x = ! kafka get-broker-metrics --broker 1
Output: 
{
"brokerMetrics": [
{
"brokerId": 1,

},

"attribute": "HeapMemoryUsed",
"value": 192278112
},
{
"attribute": "NonHeapMemoryUsed",
"value": 67263000
}
]
}
]
}

docs.title: kafka get-brokers

kafka get-brokers
    [--site <site>]

docs.title: kafka get-offset
docs.text: Get offset for Kafka topic partition

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Get offset of a particular partition of kafka topic

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
kafka get-offset
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--topic <topic>
    <partition>
    [--offset_option <offset_option>]
[--time <time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka cluster      Example: --cluster "cluster-1"      Default: default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: topic - (string)
docs.text: Name of kafka topic      Example: --topic "topic-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: partition - (int)
docs.text: Partition number      Example: 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: offset_option - (string)
docs.text: Takes one of the 2 values, "OLDEST" or "NEWEST". Provide either offset_option or time      Example: --offset_option "offset_option-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: time - (string)
docs.text: This gives the offset value at that point in time. Input should follow protobuf timestamp pattern (eg. 2020-09-01T21:46:43Z)      Example: --time "time-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka get-offset --topic "test-topic-1" 1 --offset_option "NEWEST"
Output: 
1

kafka send-messages
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
--topic <topic>
    [--asynchronous]
[--messages <messages>]

docs.title: topic - (string)

docs.title: asynchronous - (bool)
docs.text: Send messages asynchronously      Example: --asynchronous      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: messages - (string)
docs.text: Message to be sent      Example: --messages "messages-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka send-messages --asynchronous --topic "test-topic-1" `{"key":"1","value":"hi"}` `{"key":"2","value":"hello"}`
Output:

{
"topic_name":"test-topic-1",
"offset":3,
"time":{
"seconds":1653551998,

}
},
{
"topic_name":"test-topic-1",
"offset":4,
"time":{
"seconds":1653551998,
"nanos":115590761
}
}
]

docs.text: Message to be sent      Example: --messages "messages-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: all_partitions - (bool)
docs.text: boolean value to decide whether consumer should consume from all partitions      Example: --all_partitions      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: partitions - (int)
docs.text: partition number from which consumer should consume. Multiple partitions can be consumed      Example: --partitions 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: offset_option - (string)
docs.text: Value can be either "OLDEST" or "NEWEST"      Example: --offset_option "OLDEST" , --offset_option "NEWEST"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: offset_value - (int)
docs.text: offset from which messages are read in the provided partitions. Provide either offset_option or offset_value      Example: --offset_value 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! kafka send-receive-messages --asynchronous --topic "test-topic-1" `{"key":"1","value":"hi"}, {"key":"2","value":"hello"}` --partitions 1 --offset_option "OLDEST"
Output: 
[
{
"topic_name":"test-topic-1",
"partition":1,
"messages":[
{
"key":"1",
"value":"hi"
}
],
"time":{
"seconds":1653550892,
"nanos":468828435
}
}
]

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "update" Service Type "kafka" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type "topic" Object ID topic

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: pagerduty create-incidents
docs.text: Create incident

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Create a PagerDuty incident

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty create-incidents
    --site <site>
    --from <from>
    --title <title>
    --service <service>
    [--priority <priority>]
[--urgency <urgency>]
[--assignee <assignee>]
[--escalation_policy <escalation_policy>]
[--conference_number <conference_number>]
[--conference_url <conference_url>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: from - (string)
docs.text: Email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.      Example: --from "from-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: title - (string)
docs.text: A succinct description of the nature, symptoms, cause, or effect of the incident.      Example: --title "title-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: service - (string)
docs.text: service id to associate with this incident      Example: --service "service-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: priority - (string)
docs.text: priority id to associate with this incident      Example: --priority "priority-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: urgency - (string)
docs.text:
urgency of the incidents to be returned. Allowed values [high, low]      Example: --urgency "urgency-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: high, low

docs.title: assignee - (string)
docs.text: user id of the users who are to be assigned the incident      Example: --assignee "assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: escalation_policy - (string)
docs.text: escalation policy ID for this incident      Example: --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: conference_number - (string)
docs.text: conference phone number to be used for this incident      Example: --conference_number "conference_number-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: conference_url - (string)
docs.text: conference url to be used for this incident      Example: --conference_url "conference_url-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: pagerduty create-service
docs.text: Create a new service.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: A service may represent an application, component, or team you wish to open incidents against.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty create-service
    --site <site>
    --name <name>
    --escalation_policy <escalation_policy>
    [--description <description>]
[--auto_resolve_timeout <auto_resolve_timeout>]
[--acknowledgement_timeout <acknowledgement_timeout>]
[--status <status>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the service.      Example: --name "Test Service"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: escalation_policy - (string)
docs.text: id for escalation policy      Example: --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: The user-provided description of the service.      Example: --description "Test description"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: auto_resolve_timeout - (int)
docs.text: Time in seconds that an incident is automatically resolved.      Example: --auto_resolve_timeout 1      Default: 14400      Attributes: optional

docs.title: acknowledgement_timeout - (int)
docs.text: Time in seconds that an incident changes to the Triggered State after being Acknowledged.      Example: --acknowledgement_timeout 1      Default: 1800      Attributes: optional

docs.title: status - (string)
docs.text:
The current state of the Service.      Example: --status "status-1"      Default: active      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: active, warning, critical, maintenance, disabled

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty create-service --name "Test Service" --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1" --description "Test description"

docs.title: pagerduty list-incidents
docs.text: List incidents

docs.title: Description
docs.text: List PagerDuty incidents

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty list-incidents
    --site <site>
    [--limit <limit>]
[--offset <offset>]
[--incident_key <incident_key>]
[--include <include>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: limit - (int)
docs.text: The number of results per page.      Example: --limit 10      Default: 25      Attributes: optional

docs.title: offset - (int)
docs.text: Offset to start pagination search results.      Example: --offset 10      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: incident_key - (string)
docs.text: Return only the incidents associated with the passed team(s)      Example: --incident_key "incident_key-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: include - (string)
docs.text:
Array of additional details to include      Example: --include "include-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

     Validation:          allowed values: users, services, first_trigger_log_entries, escalation_policies, teams, assignees, acknowledgers, priorities, conference_bridge

    --site <site>

    --type <type>

[--priority <priority>]
[--resolution <resolution>]

docs.text:
urgency of the incidents to be returned      Example: --urgency "urgency-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: high, low

docs.title: assignee - (string)
docs.text: user id of the users who are to be assigne the incident      Example: --assignee "assignee-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: escalation_level - (int)
docs.text: Escalate the incident to this level in the escalation policy.      Example: --escalation_level 1      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: escalation_policy - (string)
docs.text: escalation policy for this incident      Example: --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: conference_number - (string)
docs.text: conference phone number to be used for this incident      Example: --conference_number "conference_number-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: conference_url - (string)
docs.text: conference url to be used for this incident      Example: --conference_url "conference_url-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty update-incidents --id "id-1" --from "from-1" --type "type-1" --status "status-1" --priority "priority-1" --resolution "resolution-1" --urgency "urgency-1" --assignee "assignee-1" --escalation_level 1 --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1" --conference_number "conference_number-1" --conference_url "conference_url-1"

docs.title: pagerduty update-services
docs.text: Update existing services.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Update existing services.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
pagerduty update-services
    --site <site>
    --id <id>
    [--name <name>]
[--description <description>]
[--auto_resolve_timeout <auto_resolve_timeout>]
[--acknowledgement_timeout <acknowledgement_timeout>]
[--alert_creation <alert_creation>]
[--status <status>]
--escalation_policy <escalation_policy>
    [--active]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: required

docs.title: id - (string)
docs.text: ID of the service.      Example: --id "id-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: name - (string)
docs.text: The name of the service.      Example: --name "name-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: description - (string)
docs.text: description of webhook subscription      Example: --description "description-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: auto_resolve_timeout - (int)
docs.text: Time in seconds, incident is automatically resolved if left open for that long.      Example: --auto_resolve_timeout 1      Default: 14400      Attributes: optional

docs.title: acknowledgement_timeout - (int)
docs.text: Time in seconds that an incident changes to the Triggered State after being Acknowledged.      Example: --acknowledgement_timeout 1      Default: 1800      Attributes: optional

docs.title: alert_creation - (string)
docs.text:
Whether a service creates only incidents, or both alerts and incidents.      Example: --alert_creation "alert_creation-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: create_incidents, create_alerts_and_incidents

docs.title: status - (string)
docs.text:
The current state of the Service.      Example: --status "status-1"      Default: active      Attributes: optional

     Validation:          allowed values: active, warning, critical, maintenance, disabled

docs.title: escalation_policy - (string)
docs.text: The Escalation Policy id      Example: --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: active - (bool)
docs.text: If true, a webhook will be sent.      Example: --active      Default: true      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text: pagerduty update-services --id "id-1" --name "name-1" --description "description-1" --alert_creation "alert_creation-1" --escalation_policy "escalation_policy-1"

The user role.      Example: --role "user"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: prometheus
docs.text:
Prometheus Commands

SubCommands:

• clean-tombstones: Clean Tombstones

• delete-series: Delete data for a selection of series in a time range

• get-alertmanagers: Get the Prometheus alertmanager discovery

• get-alerts: Get the list of active alerts

• get-build-info: Get build information properties

• get-config: Get currently loaded configuration

• get-flags: Get prometheus flags

• get-label-values: Get label values for a provided label name

• get-labels: Get list of label names

• get-metric-metadata: Get metadata about metrics currently scrapped from targets

• get-rules: Get alerting and recording rule

• get-runtime-info: Get various runtime information

• get-series: Get time series for given label set

• get-target-metadata: Get metadata about metrics scraped from targets

• get-targets: Get the Prometheus target discovery

• get-tsdb-stats: Get timeseries database statistics

• get-wal-replay-stats: Get statistics for wal replay

• query: Run a prometheus query at a single point in time

• query-exemplars: Get exemplars for given PromQL query and time range

• range-query: Run a prometheus query over a range of time

• snapshot: Create a snapshot of all current data

docs.title: prometheus clean-tombstones
docs.text: Clean Tombstones

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Clean Tombstones removes the deleted data from disk and cleans up the existing tombstones. This can be used after deleting series to free up space.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus clean-tombstones
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus clean-tombstones
Output:

docs.title: prometheus delete-series
docs.text: Delete data for a selection of series in a time range

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Delete data for a selection of series in a time range. The actual data still exists on disk and is cleaned up in future compactions or can be explicitly cleaned up by hitting the Clean Tombstones endpoint.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus delete-series
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--start_time <start_time>]
[--end_time <end_time>]
<series_selector>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start_time - (string)
docs.text: Start timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --start_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (string)
docs.text: End timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --end_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: series_selector - (string)
docs.text: label matcher argument that selects the series to delete. At least one series_selector argument must be provided.      Example: "up"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus delete-series "up"
Output:

[--start_time <start_time>]

docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: label - (string)
docs.text: Name of the label for which values are returned      Example: "job"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: series_selector - (string)
docs.text: Series selector argument that selects the series from which label values are read      Example: --series_selector "up"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: start_time - (string)
docs.text: Start timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --start_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (string)
docs.text: End timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --end_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:
To use this command, you need access to the following:

Field Value Action "read" Service Type "prometheus" Service Instance cluster Namespace Object Type Object ID

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: prometheus get-labels
docs.text: Get list of label names

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns a list of label names

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-labels
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[<series_selector>]
[--start_time <start_time>]
[--end_time <end_time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: series_selector - (string)
docs.text: Series selector argument that selects the series from which labels are read      Example: "up"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional, multiple allowed

docs.title: start_time - (string)
docs.text: Start timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --start_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (string)
docs.text: End timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --end_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus get-labels --start_time "2021-10-19T20:10:51.781Z" --end_time "2021-10-20T20:10:51.781Z" "up"
Output: 
{
"status": "success",
"data": ["__name__", "instance", "job"]
}

docs.title: Access Control
docs.text:

Please see Access Control for details.

docs.title: prometheus get-metric-metadata
docs.text: Get metadata about metrics currently scrapped from targets

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns metadata about metrics currently scrapped from targets. However, it does not provide any target information

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-metric-metadata
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--metric <metric>]
[--limit <limit>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: metric - (string)
docs.text: A metric name to filter metadata for      Example: --metric "http_requests_total"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: limit - (int)
docs.text: Maximum number of metrics to return.      Example: --limit 2      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:

! prometheus get-metric-metadata

docs.title: prometheus get-rules
docs.text: Get alerting and recording rule

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns a list of alerting and recording rules that are currently loaded. In addition it returns the currently active alerts fired by the Prometheus instance of each alerting rule.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-rules
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--type <type>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: type - (string)
docs.text: Used to filter rules (either alert or record). Possible values are alert, record      Example: --type "alert"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus get-rules --type "alert"
Output: 
{
"status": "success",
"data": {
"groups": [
{
"name": "alert_rules",
"file": "/usr/local/bin/prometheus/prometheus_rules.yml",
"rules": [
{
"state": "firing",
"name": "InstanceDown",
"query": "up == 0",
"duration": 15,
"labels": {
"severity": "critical"
},
"annotations": {
"description": "[{{ $labels.instance }}] of job [{{ $labels.job }}] has been down for more than 1 minute.",
"summary": "Instance [{{ $labels.instance }}] down"
},
"alerts": [
{
"labels": {
"alertname": "InstanceDown",
"instance": "localhost:9100",
"job": "node-exporter",
"severity": "critical"
},
"annotations": {
"description": "[localhost:9100] of job [node-exporter] has been down for more than 1 minute.",
"summary": "Instance [localhost:9100] down"
},
"state": "firing",
"activeAt": "2021-10-13T12:05:20.566139241Z",
"value": "0e+00"
},
{
"labels": {
"alertname": "InstanceDown",
"instance": "localhost:1234",
"job": "kafka",
"severity": "critical"
},
"annotations": {
"description": "[localhost:1234] of job [kafka] has been down for more than 1 minute.",
"summary": "Instance [localhost:1234] down"
},
"state": "firing",
"activeAt": "2021-10-13T12:05:20.566139241Z",
"value": "0e+00"
}
],
"health": "ok",
"evaluationTime": 0.001672296,
"lastEvaluation": "2021-10-21T08:07:35.567271977+05:30",
"type": "alerting"
}
],
"interval": 15,
"evaluationTime": 0.001713941,
"lastEvaluation": "2021-10-21T08:07:35.567239362+05:30"
},
{
"name": "custom_rules",
"file": "/usr/local/bin/prometheus/prometheus_rules.yml",
"rules": [],
"interval": 15,
"evaluationTime": 0.000517493,
"lastEvaluation": "2021-10-21T08:07:44.069116798+05:30"
}
]
}
}

docs.title: prometheus get-runtime-info
docs.text: Get various runtime information

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns various runtime information properties about the Prometheus server

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-runtime-info
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus get-runtime-info
Output: 
{
"status": "success",
"data": {
"startTime": "2021-10-13T12:05:08.252857048Z",
"CWD": "/",
"reloadConfigSuccess": true,
"lastConfigTime": "2021-10-13T12:05:09Z",
"corruptionCount": 0,
"goroutineCount": 31,
"GOMAXPROCS": 4,
"GOGC": "",
"GODEBUG": "",
"storageRetention": "15d"
}
}

docs.title: prometheus get-series
docs.text: Get time series for given label set

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns the list of time series that match a certain label set.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-series
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--start_time <start_time>]
[--end_time <end_time>]
<series_selector>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: start_time - (string)
docs.text: Start timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --start_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (string)
docs.text: End timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --end_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: series_selector - (string)
docs.text: Series selector argument that selects the series to return.      Example: "up"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required, multiple allowed

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus get-series --start_time "2021-10-19T20:10:51.781Z" --end_time "2021-10-20T20:10:51.781Z" "up"
Output: 
{
"status": "success",
"data": [
{
"__name__": "up",
"instance": "localhost:1234",
"job": "kafka"
},
{
"__name__": "up",
"instance": "localhost:9090",
"job": "prometheus"
},
{
"__name__": "up",
"instance": "localhost:9100",
"job": "node-exporter"
}
]
}

docs.title: prometheus get-target-metadata
docs.text: Get metadata about metrics scraped from targets

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns metadata about metrics currently scraped from targets

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-target-metadata
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--label <label>]
[--label_value <label_value>]
[--metric <metric>]
[--limit <limit>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: label - (string)
docs.text: Name of Label selector used to match targets      Example: --label "job, instance"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: label_value - (string)
docs.text: Value of Label selector used to match targets      Example: --label_value "prometheus, 127.0.0.1:9000"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: metric - (string)
docs.text: A metric name to retrieve metadata for      Example: --metric "go_goroutines"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: limit - (int)
docs.text: Maximum number of targets to match      Example: --limit 2      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

! prometheus get-target-metadata --label "job" --label_value "prometheus"

docs.title: prometheus get-targets
docs.text: Get the Prometheus target discovery

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns an overview of the current state of the Prometheus target discovery

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus get-targets
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[<state>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: state - (string)
docs.text: Used to filter targets (either active or dropped). Possible values are active, dropped, any      Example: "active"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

! prometheus get-targets "active"

docs.title: prometheus query-exemplars
docs.text: Get exemplars for given PromQL query and time range

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Returns a list of exemplars for a valid PromQL query for a specific time range

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus query-exemplars
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<query>
    [--start_time <start_time>]
[--end_time <end_time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Valid PromQL query      Example: "test_exemplar_metric_total"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: start_time - (string)
docs.text: Start timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --start_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: end_time - (string)
docs.text: End timestamp (inclusive, Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --end_time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus query-exemplars --start_time "2021-10-19T20:10:51.781Z" --end_time "" "test_exemplar_metric_total"
Output: 
{
"status": "success",
"data": null
}

docs.title: prometheus query
docs.text: Run a prometheus query at a single point in time

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Evaluates an instant query at a single point in time

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus query
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
<query>
    [--time <time>]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Query expression in promQL format      Example: "up"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: time - (time)
docs.text: Evaluation timestamp. Query is evaluated at this time (Should be provided in rfc3339 format)      Example: --time "2015-07-01T20:10:51.781Z"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus query "up"
Output: 
{
"status": "success",
"data": {
"resultType": "vector",
"result": [
{
"metric": {
"__name__": "up",
"instance": "localhost:1234",
"job": "kafka"
},

},

"job": "prometheus"
},
"value": [1634749948.86, "1"]
},
{
"metric": {
"__name__": "up",
"instance": "localhost:9100",
"job": "node-exporter"
},
"value": [1634749948.86, "0"]
}
]
}
}

docs.title: prometheus snapshot
docs.text: Create a snapshot of all current data

docs.title: Description
docs.text: Creates a snapshot of all current data into snapshots/- under the TSDB's data directory and returns the directory as response. It will optionally skip snapshotting data that is only present in the head block, and which has not yet been compacted to disk.

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
prometheus snapshot
    [--site <site>]
[--cluster <cluster>]
[--skip_head]

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: cluster - (string)
docs.text: Name of prometheus cluster      Example: --cluster "prometheus-default"      Default: prometheus-default      Attributes: optional

docs.title: skip_head - (bool)
docs.text: Skip data present in the head block      Example: --skip_head      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

! prometheus snapshot
Output: 
{
"status": "success",
"data": {
"name": "20211021T115101Z-25ffe8c87b4ff6da"
}
}

docs.title: rds
docs.text:
AWS RDS commands

SubCommands:

• run-sql: Run SQL Query

docs.title: rds run-sql
docs.text: Run SQL Query

docs.title: Description
docs.text: run sql query in aws rds mysql instance

docs.title: Synopsis
docs.text:
rds run-sql
    [--site <site>]
[--region <region>]
[--host <host>]
[--database <database>]
<query>

docs.title: site - (string)
docs.text: Site where this command will be executed      Example: --site "site-1"      Default: input.site      Attributes: optional

docs.title: region - (string)
docs.text: AWS region for the service      Example: --region "region-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: host - (string)
docs.text: Host name for database instance      Example: --host "host-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: database - (string)
docs.text: Database name      Example: --database "database-1"      Default: _None_      Attributes: optional

docs.title: query - (string)
docs.text: Sql Query      Example: "select * from accounts"      Default: _None_      Attributes: required

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
Input: 

x=! rds run-sql --host "host1" "create database testdb"
Output:
Input: 
x=! rds run-sql --host "host1" "select * from movies.movies"
Output: 
[                                                                                                                                                                  {
"director": "Todd Phillips",
"genre": "psychological thriller",
"release_year": 2019,
"title": "Joker"
},
{
"director": "Karan Johar",
"genre": "psychological thriller",
"release_year": 2020,
"title": "Movie1"
}
]
Input: 
! rds run-sql --host "host1" "select * from movies.movies"
Output:
